4lXVkIIgJjkMgx3JwNFj4Q.text: Not out of the world fish and chips. But it was really decent and probably the best I ever had. Lots of seats during noon and servers are friendly and laid back! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Garfunkels - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips and chicken tenders

Pe9g7Hy-M5-t8uRukPF6_A.text: Was looking for a place to eat during a busy day of site-seeing in London. Their lunch menu looked promising so we stopped in, but their food was unfortunately pretty terrible and our waitress was very rude and charged us for items that we did not order. Was pretty disappointed and left without eating our food. Don't waste your time.

_GYi-nrq4_lLzQrVehZuBQ.text: We we from New York city,And Visiting London we Ended  up here. My husband gave it a four star for his meal. But I give it a 1 star for the Code fish and chips meal horrible. But the staff is amazing so will I recommend it yes because our waiter she was so sweet.Just don't get the Fish and chips meal if you like tasty fried fish this is not the place for fish and chips

c_bb9a9p6yFi70d7GieUAQ.text: We ate here on our first night in London, primarily as it was two doors down from our hotel and we were too jet-lagged to be adventurous.  The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't great.  My burger seemed somewhat pre-fab.  My daughter's meatballs in her spaghetti had what she described as an 'Asian vibe'.  I don't recall what my wife got.I wouldn't actively avoid this place, but with all the other choices available in London, I doubt I'd go back.

oMLBI6CmPtnEq8Z4M-_a_Q.text: We are the Garfunkel special and pancakes. Very tasteful! The Garfunkel special was eggs bacon sausage baked beans a mushroom a tomato and toast. Our pancakes were sumer berries and yogurt. The waitor was very nice.

053LSoE3op3jcEaW9wW6ZA.text: It's a popular chain establishment, but I don't think you can really go wrong with Garfunkel's.If you're looking to tentatively try some British favorites without breaking the bank on a specialty place, I'd say this is a good place to go. I had their Garfunkel's Breakfast -- which, to someone who normally avoids breakfast diners like Denny's or IHOP in the States -- was a blessing. The food is of good quality for a chain -- it's obvious to see that items are mass-produced and/or sent in packages to each franchise, but the preparation is good and the cooks perform their functions well.Service at this venue was also good -- my server was attentive and came by often to check on whether I needed more refills of my cappucino (free refills if bought with a 5.95GBP breakfast deal)! No complaints! It's a great place to go if on a budget or a time crunch.

528-yxnWHgL9vrlE6r67Xg.text: Was impressed with the food as this was part of a chain.  Allowed us to sit outside with our dog, service was a little slow thougg

photos.caption: Photo of Garfunkels - London, United Kingdom. Lunch by trafalgar square

5JNq3QDlc6bGueW8izhaDw.text: Alright, let me just say this: There are a lot of really cool things about the United Kingdom, especially London. The history, the architecture, the diversity, the attractions, a lot of cool things.The food is not one of them.I hate to say it, but that stereotype about England having horrible food is kind of true. Unless it's an upscale restaurant, most of the average diners and cafes on the street are not that great. I'd take a Sonic above a Pret-a-Manger any day, sorry guys.However, I remember Garfunkel's, at least this location (which I believe is the one right by Trafalgar Square), as being above average. Their shepherd's pie was tasty, as were the chips (fries). They had a decent beer selection, and seating was nice inside and on the sidewalk. Their prices weren't too bad, although keep in mind this is London and buying a soda will cost you an arm and a leg.

6RDdcf6g6Suh2qzkNtWaow.text: One experience so who really knows.  I know this is a chain but after 6 days and countless miles of everything wonderful about London I still hadn't had fish and chips.  Now don't roll your eyes that I went to a chain...I was so tired and this was right by my hotel...and I gotta say whatever spice mix is in that batter...loved it, double yum.  I do like my chips crispier though but that's just me.

V5Q4FGcElNuLmwbLB76dag.text: Free wifi! Good location and considering people were queuing to get into most of the restaurants in the area this one you could walk in and get a table! The waitress was really friendly and very patient! There's music playing in the background and the seats are pretty comfy! The food service didn't take that long and I would come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Garfunkels - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate milkshake and a glass of water ! Yum

z_oGETCBa21CXKcgOdp7aQ.text: Went to Garfunkels after a long walk and was excited because the people inside looked relatively happy with their food, they deceived me. The waitress took about 15-20 minutes to come over and ask us what we would like to drink.  I order a Carbonara pasta, this pasta was false advertising. It tasted tangy and weirdly unsettling. The burger that my friend received tasted and looked like the bland burger that a child at school in America would be given for $1. Nothing was seasoned... I drenched my pasta in salt and pepper. We make it clear that we have finished eating. The waitress then takes about 20 Minutes to come over and ring us up. We ask to do a separate check from each other. She says "we don't do separate checks but you can separate your checks with the machine." She immediately contradicted herself. Lol. We finally have completely paid and leave immediately, she got a £2.20 tip. I would strongly recommend that while you are touring London you skip this restaurant. It won't add any pleasure to your experience and it might make you strongly dislike Trafalgar Square.

yBkpSJ7vo5zuSF6_xjXsqA.text: Very delicious and fresh salad bar and a great burger.Try out there lunch options for a great value for money and enjoy refills for your soft drinks.

1IgjNEn31Gq1-WE6bmGLiw.text: Ate here on a busy Sat. evening in December.  The other reviewers have summed it up nicely.  This place feels like a Denny's, and it's probably best for people who are traveling with a family of 4 or more.  The place is fairly spacious and the location is great.  The service was good too.I ordered fish & chips, and while it was edible, the fish tasted like the kind you get in the frozen food section of the supermarket.  My wife got a cheeseburger, which was seasoned okay, but the meat was closer in consistency to ground turkey.  Fries were good.

ttqHH-BDbde9xClns8oLdg.text: I have to admit I don't like chain restaurants, and I got dragged to this one for a quick bite.  It reminded me of Denny's, a place I won't eat at.  Had a burger, which was dry but somewhat palatable with the ketchup/relish mix on top.  My companions were not too fond of their food either, and service was quite slow.  I'd say that if one has kids, this could be ok, but I wouldn't bring my kids here.  The second star is only because the server was very friendly, but it's not a good restaurant for people who actually like food.

AgsnVdq9z378n93476oteQ.text: For a chain with more outlets all over London than i can count you would think it would be at least edible. We popped in for breakfast and not only was the food not edible the poor server was so overwhelmed I felt awful for him. There were other servers but ours seemed to have a disproportionate amount of the dining room and seemed truly stressed. My water glass was filthy, the eggs just gross and I really only ate my toast. My kids ate the hash browns and I'm not sure my hubby ate any of his. On subsequent trips by this particular location there are always diners in there but I have been tempted to tell people we have seen looking at the menu to keep walking!!!

WTnZqqmODoFbZda2ufb1sg.text: Not impressed. We had a long day and just wanted something quick to eat and literally thought kfc (yes, even on vacation), but husband wanted fish & chips so we got some to-go. It was okay (came with mashed peas which I thought was weird). I got the pie & mash which was mediocre. If you've read any of my other reviews, I almost always say good things about potatoes but I guess even potatoes won't do the dish any justice. It wasn't distinguishing, but still disappointing nonetheless. Chilli poppers were good and came with salsa that tasted like it came from a jar--the one you dip with your Doritos while watching American football or something. Oh, and I would come back to Denny's, however, my husband will really have to really be convincing if he wants me to eat here again... And I mean real magical type of convincing, so it's hardly comparable to Denny's (which I would rate three.five stars for the type of food).

VQ9M8rTtkPFyONJIt4wcig.text: Ugh, horrible.  I got a chicken caesar wrap which I could have made better myself.  There was too much dressing, and the lettuce was old.  My mom got fish and chips which was decent, but the fish wasn't very fresh and the chips were just warm.  My recommendation would be to grab a sandwich at Pret a Manger around the corner!

RFN9stC88GhU51cfJYKdQw.text: I'm normally not big on chain restaurants...  But when you're in a hurry and it's close, it can usually help in a pinch.  Why then, did this Garfunkels have no chips, no sour cream, and no chicken when my partner and I decided to stop in.  That should have been our cue to leave, but no we stayed...  My partner had a cheeseburger with mashed potatoes and I had Country Pie.  They were okay, nothing to rave about.  About halfway through I wished we had gone elsewhere.

DT7FWvoqnUuVPMp3Q6JUjw.text: Nothing too spectacular, general fare for a chain restaurant; soggy chips and those sh*y little plastic containers you get dips in. The waitresses weren't the most attentive but in fairness to them they seemed a bit understaffed. Good for hangover comfort food but not much else!

wbs2l2w8TXAEOAz_OWcF4A.text: Went here for Lunch, its very close to The center of London. I had the fish and chips ( classic London meal) food was great large portions, had there London Pride great beer. Prices and service was good we had a great time.

photos.caption: Photo of Garfunkels - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Garfunkels - London, United Kingdom

RBsZ4-SIVqXWpuAsDpbXJA.text: Garfunkels is like the English version of Claimjumper, minus the massive American portions. A chain that offers traditional English breakfast amongst other standard fare. I've been to this location twice; once in 2010 and again during my recent visit.The food is usually good and service prompt. I don't recommend the fried calamari, though. I ordered it the last time I was here and it was stringy and had a fishy aftertaste. No bueno. The English breakfast is always a good bet and it's served all day. Kid's menu offers the usual stuff (pasta, nuggets, pizza, etc). While it may not be the most original or glamorous place to dine while you're in London, it will serve its purpose if you're looking for a no frills, but sit down, quick bite to eat in a family friendly setting.

3thjkGu4gjknO2reIOEwpg.text: First time in London on holiday/business travel.   Was starving and popped in here on a whim.   Almost left when I realized it was a chain, but thought I'd give it a shot.   It definitely lived up to every American mediocre chain restaurant stereotype.    The staff was all over the place and barely paid any attention to our table.   The food itself was really bland and seemed to come straight off a freezer truck in pre-portioned packages.   Rookie tourist mistake in going there.   The one perk is they do have wifi - but that is almost everywhere nowadays.   There are too many other good spots around town - I would avoid it.

DJtd38unzzNK8SJ0Zo_QYQ.text: I wish I would have checked yelp before going to Garfunkel's. The Hawaiian pizza was a waste. Super thin crust and little sauce or ham or cheese

-Q2IZbYqnLtGyqnN_1qnZQ.text: Please don't go there if you want to have a drink. They have the policy of no alcohol, even beer, if you don't order food there. Disappointing for a city like London.

photos.caption: Photo of Garfunkels - London, United Kingdom. No beer if you don't order food policy

B7hbWkRbfWgNvdlnn8MPsg.text: The food is ok. The service is pretty bad.  Although the staff is very friendly. I'm not sure if my expectations as an American are skewing my opinion, but every time I've come here (close to my hotel) the service has been slow.  That said, I keep coming back because the coffee is great and, as I said, it's close to where I'm staying.

EtdoI2ZIkk6lZnyF1KMBmQ.text: While the ambience and location is great, I thought the food was very average. The eggs Benedict was good, but nothing super special. I also tried the avocado toast which was refreshing and had mangoes (!!) but the portion was pretty small. Overall it wasn't bad, but was a little bland.

photos.caption: Photo of Garfunkels - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict, potatoes, avocado toast

rT5pNBCRSlhfQAsFUpxm6Q.text: Good food at a reasonable price.  Friendly staff.  Had classic fish and chips.  Close to my hotel so returned four times!

agamsxZRlbYfRdt_-RcPKw.text: DON'T GO! So so disappointed.  This is only busy because its in a hot tourist area. The food is a joke. The chocale shake had no ice cream in it. They evwn remade it and it came out the same. They were out of all pot pies no chick no beef.  Ordered southern fried chicken sandwich it was just 2 chicken tenders in a sandwich. Very sad sandwich. . The only dissent items was jalapeño poppers were okay. And  the french frys werw okay. In general just a shame and the manager should be fired.

SXsxaVWkw-9Pw4ILEMacVA.text: Perfect place for a small family looking to dip off the street, use the washroom, and enjoy some B+ food at a fair busy-Londony-area price. I'll leave it right there with a bow on it :)

HyqBC6KPb4FRLT03V-UNoQ.text: The food at Garfunkel's was surprising good. I had the fish and chips and I was very pleased. My friend had the Tower burger and she said it was delicious. It was huge too. The service was a little slow, but not enough to complain. It was recommended by security at the National Museum, across the street and is definitely worth recommending.

FlhXo9m2HiRa4sayGqZUtw.text: Tasty! I got the cottage pie. It was covered in a tad too much salt and pepper, but otherwise a very satisfying meal. Our group split the double decker dessert-- holy cow. It was larger than we expected, but we finished it pretty quickly because it wasn't overly rich, just tasty. The staff were helpful and though it seemed like they were really busy, it didn't take too long to get service. I totally would recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Garfunkels - London, United Kingdom. The Double Decker.

h4s2ndF7h6jqV-xyBQN55g.text: Fairly average.  I got the British Breakfast and my friend got the fish and chips.  The scrambled eggs of the breakfast tasted a bit watered down but the sausage and bacon were not too bad.  Perhaps the fried eggs would have been better.  The fish and chips, which I tried, was mediocre.  It hit the spot as we were hungry, but nothing really spectacular.    The service was decent and it had good atmosphere.  Good for a quick bite and go.

photos.caption: Photo of Garfunkels - London, United Kingdom. British Breakfast!

dhho2qlBb3NCOdNlwQjHTw.text: I came out of the Charing Cross Underground station, and wanted some lunch before heading into the museums.  This was right there, and I'd already seen ads coming up the escalator from the Tube.  So in I went.  It was food, it was decent, it was not too slow.  I had a quarter rotisserie chicken.  The advertised wifi didn't work.

4Ik0hMl37KQeZ-P6bq8TWQ.text: This was an awesome stop during our vacation. Food was classically English and everything was delicious, especially the fish and chips. But the cherry on top was the service. Our waiter, Giolio, was very helpful and had awesome recommendations for us. Plus he didn't even blink at my crazy complicated order. Thanks for an awesome dinner!

ApxJqJ8a1Hra61cBoSOzsw.text: 8/30/14: This is such a late review! So, we came across Garfunkels and we were extremely hungry! Plenty of room to sit. Servers were friendly. I have noticed that servers in Europe are a lot more laid back compared to the U.S. at first it was weird but I learned to just enjoy my meals without hurrying. You can't ever go wrong with Garfunkels. It was a great experience. This location was very clean and friendly. Awesome of choices in their menu and affordable.

Z37fQEt22sX4CPMazcD7iA.text: Went for pre-theatre dinner, and I quite liked it. I ordered the spaghetti with blue cheese and vegetables -- it was good, and the portions were adequate too. My favourite part about this restaurant was the service. The staff were very friendly and prompt -- one of the best experiences I've had in terms of service. As many have already mentioned, this is a chain with a diner-type of feel, so come if you're looking for a casual, down to earth ambience. All in all, a good experience.

8ZCS4XyTtOTWIkvZ8IrCtw.text: right around Trafalgar Square, this British chain restaurant seemed like a good place to try British food for two weary travelers. And they had free WiFi =DI got a beef pot pie (of sorts) which was decent. The gf ordered salmon cakes which were pretty good too. Service was good.No real complaints except a regret that I should have just ordered more fish & chips =P

photos.caption: Photo of Garfunkels - London, United Kingdom. beef pie and salmon cakes
Photo of Garfunkels - London, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee pudding with ice cream
Photo of Garfunkels - London, United Kingdom. Beef pot pie

TCnZXVwO9b7W04s19vrKRQ.text: Why all the haters?? I had a huge breakfast that was delicious ! The two breakfast sausages were the size of Italian sausages and tasty! The bread was thick sliced and fresh too! I'm going back today!

photos.caption: Photo of Garfunkels - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Garfunkels - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Garfunkels - London, United Kingdom

gQFQ1HU-4kydn9Qmba-0XA.text: Our waitress disappeared, coffee had no flavor and by far the worst pancakes I've had in my life. The pancakes taste like cardboard that was microwaved. Not all the food was bad a disappointment to eat there.
